"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents discuss various aspects of diabetes mellitus and its relationship with coronary artery disease. The first document highlights that patients with insulin-dependent diabetes are more likely to have severe narrowings, multiple vessel involvement, and distal segments affected, indicating advanced atherosclerotic lesions. The third document describes anatomic changes in the biliary tract and pancreas in diabetic patients. The fourth document explores the relationship between coronary disease and peripheral arterial disease.

Given this information, we can infer that complex coronary lesions are indeed more frequent in patients with diabetes mellitus.",
